isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9200, 9300, 9400 Models Built After January 1, 1995 - BATTERY, CHARGING & CRANKING SYSTEMS - OPERATION - Cranking Motor Circuits

svcproc.title: Cranking Motor Circuits
svcproc.para: Refer to CHARGING AND CRANKING circuit diagrams in CTS-5119S. With the key in the START position, ignition voltage from Start Feed Adapter (509) is applied through circuit 17B to energize the Starter Magnetic Switch.

Battery power from the B1 battery stud (circuit 14A) is always present at the B terminal of the Magnetic Switch. With the Start Magnetic Switch energized, battery power is applied through circuit 17C to energize the crank motor solenoid.

With the crank motor solenoid energized, the solenoid engages the cranking motor and battery power causes the motor to rotate. When the starter switch is released, a spring returns the solenoid to the released position.
